title: Authors and Citation
text: Chuche N (2024). timemoir: Check Memory Used Functions. R package version 0.3.0.9000, https://nbc.github.io/timemoir/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {timemoir: Check Memory Used By Functions},   author = {Nicolas Chuche},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0.9000},   url = {https://nbc.github.io/timemoir/}, }

title: Check Memory Used By Functions
text: goal timemoir get memory usage large functions many things (like duckdb arrow calculation). utils::Rprof profmem don’t work well use case. achieve goal, timemoir fork R processus execute function main processus read memory usage /proc/<pid>/status. bit crude works well . package reads /proc/<pid>/status, doesn’t work windows.

title: Check Memory Used By Functions
text: can install development version timemoir like :

title: Check Memory Used By Functions
code: library(timemoir)  my_fun <- function(sec) {   Sys.sleep(sec) }  timemoir(my_fun(1), my_fun(2), my_fun()) #> benchmarking function my_fun(1) :  #> benchmarking function my_fun(2) :  #> benchmarking function my_fun() : #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   fname     duration error                                max_mem #>   <chr>        <dbl> <chr>                                  <dbl> #> 1 my_fun(1)       NA "could not find function \"my_fun\""       0 #> 2 my_fun(2)       NA "could not find function \"my_fun\""       0 #> 3 my_fun()        NA "could not find function \"my_fun\""       0

title: Benchmark functions — timemoir
text: launch functions background watch pid file get max used memory

title: Benchmark functions — timemoir
text: ... functions benchmark. verbose boolean. TRUE (default) print information messages.

title: Benchmark functions — timemoir
text: tibble `fname`, function name (string) passed   `timemoir`, max_mem` max used memory, `duration` duration   function (NA function fails) `error`, error message   function fails (NA function pass)

title: Benchmark functions — timemoir
code: timemoir(Sys.sleep(2), Sys.sleep()) #> benchmarking function Sys.sleep(2) : .. #> benchmarking function Sys.sleep() :  #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   fname        duration error                                           max_mem #>   <chr>           <dbl> <chr>                                             <dbl> #> 1 Sys.sleep(2)     2.00  NA                                                   0 #> 2 Sys.sleep()     NA    "argument \"time\" is missing, with no default"       0  timemoir(Sys.sleep(1), Sys.sleep(), verbose=FALSE) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   fname        duration error                                           max_mem #>   <chr>           <dbl> <chr>                                             <dbl> #> 1 Sys.sleep(1)     1.00  NA                                                1408 #> 2 Sys.sleep()     NA    "argument \"time\" is missing, with no default"       0

title: timemoir 0.3.0.9000
text: allow benchmarking multiple functions using ellipsis. max_mem returned now max_mem - min_mem. add verbose parameter.
